alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Horry; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 20 at 8:57PM EDT until July 20 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... South central Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... Northeastern Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 856 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Outland, or 22 miles southwest of Conway, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Surfside Beach, Pawleys Island, Garden City, Murrells Inlet, Hemingway, Rhems, Burgess, Oatland, Nesmith, Indiantown, Plantersville, Outland, Yauhannah, Litchfield Beach, Morrisville, Henry, Stuckey and Waccamaw Community Hospital. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
